meanings.definition: Not intended to teach or instruct.
meanings.sent1: The story was undidactic, simply meant for enjoyment.
meanings.sent2: The undidactic movie focused on entertainment rather than life lessons.
meanings.sent3: The undidactic cartoon made us laugh without trying to teach us anything.
meanings.sent4: Her undidactic approach to storytelling was like a breath of fresh air.
meanings.sent5: The undidactic nature of the painting left room for personal interpretation.

meanings.sent1: The undidactic novel allowed readers to draw their own conclusions.
meanings.sent2: His undidactic speech avoided preaching or moral lessons.
meanings.sent3: The undidactic play kept the audience engaged without being preachy.
meanings.sent4: The undidactic tone of the poem was refreshing in its lack of moralizing.
meanings.sent5: The undidactic nature of the sculpture left room for individual reflection.
